qas.question: Which police force in London does not typically engage in police activity with the general public?
What area of London does the Metropolitan Police Service cover?

answers.text: Greater London, with the exception of the City of London

qas.question: What agency is responsible for policing rail services in London?
What department runs the Metropolitan Police Service?

answers.text: the Mayor's Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC).

qas.question: What is the name of the City of London's police force?

context: Policing in <a1_0>Greater London, with the exception of the City of London<a1_0/>, is provided by the Metropolitan Police Service, overseen by the Mayor through <a3_0>the Mayor's Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC).<a3_0/> The City of London has its own police force – <a4_0>the City of London Police<a4_0/>. <a2_0>The British Transport Police<a2_0/> are responsible for police services on National Rail, London Underground, Docklands Light Railway and Tramlink services. A fourth police force in London, <a0_0>the Ministry of Defence Police<a0_0/>, do not generally become involved with policing the general public.
